reviews.text: I use to come here quite frequently I dnt eat seafood but I like their frozen drinks .. this place has went DOWN ! Customer service is no good ! I came in today to order a few drinks and I was total ignored! By the hostess and the bartender I asked 3 times can I order for the bartender to completely ignore me . His head was down in his phone and not once did he look up to pay me any mind ! I just walked out . Won‚Äôt be coming back
Lovely food and staff - the fish is amazing (someone from England)

We enjoy the late night Happy hour.
The only thing is music- would be nice if dj plays mix music... to cater to all..
Loved this place! Came for food and drinks. I got a hot lobster roll and my bf the wagyu burger and both were good. The drinks were so good, my fav was the coco brew martini
Oyster happy hr... every. Single. Day!!

I was so disappointed in sea wolf. We came here to kill time before a show. As soon as we came in our waitress/host had a stank attitude. We sat down at a high top and while she was accommodating by switching us to a regular table she barely said two words to us. We ordered the seafood tower and they forgot the claw crackers, napkins and spare plates for shells. The Diet Coke was flat and undrinkable and the soup we got was mid at best. The lobster bisque was a spicy tomato soup at best and the clam chowder was just a cream soup. While eating it my partner noticed a ‚Äústring‚Äù like object in her chowder. I showed it to our waitress and she showed the manager, she showed the chef and the conclusion they came up with was a sliver of an onion peel. We were so turned off. They took the sodas off the bill but not the soup.
I would never recommend this place EVER to anyone.
great atmosphere! tasty food. try the lobster special w/ 90 min unlimited drinks..

Love their food but on random late nights they ask for id at the door to even sit at a table.  My friend had a photo of her passport and we expressed we only wanted to order food at a table and the bouncer asked for a bribe to let her in‚Ä¶to order food‚Ä¶we‚Äôre in our 30s.

I‚Äôve been here a few times, but the service this time was really slow. They didn‚Äôt even put our order in and offered no compensation. We waited entirely too long, but everyone was friendly. Drinks were great minus the old fashioned but that was our fault who orders an old-fashioned at a seafood joint üòÖ. The lobster roll was sadly mediocre at best which is sad for $35.
Great
Over rated EVERYTHING.

This place was so so fire. The music was so on point we couldn‚Äôt help but dance. We weren‚Äôt intending in coming here but the vibes dragged us in. Edwardo from the restaurant also gave us a FREE BOTTLE of don Julio with chasers. Amazing
Love it here, service and vibe is amazing!!! Dan is awesome!!! Musics fire too
Literally the best brunch spot in Bushwick. Best bloody marys. Dan is AMAZING.
Love seawolf! Always a good time w great food and great service! Great fruity frozens
Dan slays I love it here
Í∞ÄÏûê!

Just left brunch where I was literally jamming out to every song! The bartender was playing the greatest pop punk playlist I have ever heard.  My scene girl teenage self was THRIVING!! ++ food and drinks were amazing as usual
Daniel was great! super informative and kind. food was good and quick! the Ube shooter was so good and the brussels sprouts amazing ! will be back for brunch!
DANIEL IS THE MAN. AMAZING SERVICE.
Excellent service from Daniel, beautiful freckles, and accomodated our seating request.
Daniel was superb
Daniel was the best!
Come here all the time - love
Live laugh love Seawolf bushwick
1st time here and will absolutely be back!!!! Food and drinks were 10/10. Our server Danny was funny friendly and on point! Every recommendation was delicious and satisfying. All hits no misses
Danny was AMAZING! Great time with my girls and the food was great.
delish!
Excelente experiencia , volver√≠a sin duda cada vez que est√© en Nueva York
Gone twice now and I love the happy hour specials! Great price for oysters and wings.
SeaWolf is my 2nd home
Audrian and Daniel were great energy. Food was really good. Didn‚Äôt drink but would definitely come back for their happy hour!
Daniel and Audrian were 10/10. Place is such a cute vibe. Recommend for a summer bop or a cozy fall day. Good happy hour and music selection is chefs kiss
Great food and great vibes!
Good sidewalk seats, easy happy hour. Service is bushwick standard. I come back!
Food is amazing!! The service is amazing. The staff is so welcoming and kind. Great atmosphere too. Love it here!!
This place is awesome. Emma and Daniel are the best!
Daniel was great! He recognized us and welcomed us back! Our go to spot for happy hour!
Daniel and Emma were great!! Oysters were fresh and delicious
Always a vibe with Daniel

Sea Wolf completely blew me away on my last visit! The highlight of the meal was without a doubt the lobster mac and cheese ‚Äî rich, creamy, and packed with flavor, it‚Äôs easily one of the best I‚Äôve ever had.

Every bite was indulgent but perfectly balanced, with generous chunks of lobster that made it feel really special. On top of the incredible food, the service was equally impressive.

Our server Emma was attentive and made us feel truly taken care of throughout the night. She checked in often without hovering and made sure everything was just right. Between the amazing food and excellent service, Sea Wolf delivered a five-star experience I can‚Äôt wait to repeat.

This establishment has brought shame to the concept of fine dining, and I was thoroughly disappointed with the outrage they call fish and chips. I arrived with optimistic high hopes, and to my dismay they were marginally under ceded. I had the pleasure of having a lovely waitress, however this perk was extremely undermined how the management treat their workers. This sort of attitude towards the staff took away from the  experience itself, and I hope that action is taken place or a bad review would be the least of the restaurants problems.
Good drinks üçª
Highly recommend Sea Wolf! The lobster mac & cheese is absolutely amazing. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the area.

Nice decor inside and outdoor seating/views are great for people watching in Bushwick. HH offered a nice deal and I got the painkiller with a rum shooter. Overall, decent food and great drinks. Seats are not the most comfortable but it‚Äôs a good place spot I‚Äôd visit again to try other items

SeaWolf used to be a Bushwick staple. Now it is a shell of itself. Prices keep climbing while the food slides further downhill. What was once restaurant quality now feels like diner fare. I keep coming back hoping for the old magic but leave disappointed every time.

If you go, stick to drinks and small bites. The mains are a hard pass. Sad to watch a spot that once mattered fade into mediocrity.

My only complaint is that it is too GD hot indoors for an oyster place. Like borderline worried for the oysters sake. Outside is a dream and the heat has never deterred me so let that speak to how good their food and drinks are. The Ube Marg is delightful, the oysters were great, and they do a killer Brussels sprout. I‚Äôve been back multiple times. Just begging for a better indoor AC. Still 5/5.

Service needs improvement: New ownership just in the past few months and new turnover staff recently has lowered my dining service experience but the food is still excellent. I‚Äôve been going here for years and it‚Äôs only recently service is changed. New servers need to learn and study the menu much better, kitchen needs better communication with servers on orders, plates all need to be checked for accuracy with the menu by kitchen, server and mgmt before heading to the table. Service should include offering condiments with certain dishes, and there should be better follow up after food is served. My brunch item was all kinds of messed up, table water tasted off. Maybe just an off day but it‚Äôs obvious new mgmt needs much improvement. Bathrooms were horrendous. Cooks are still amazing tho. I‚Äôll give this place another chance bc it‚Äôs always been one of my favorites.

Went for happy hour, the staff was meh. Even at a $1.50 some of the oysters shouldn‚Äôt have even been served. Being charged for the sliver of flesh that was in quite a few of them was criminal. Overpriced mediocre food, will not be returning
Don't get the ceviche, but the oyster happy hour is fire.
Ï†ÑÎ∞òÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÎßõÏûàÏóàÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÏßÅÏõêÎèÑ ÏπúÏ†àÌñàÏäµÎãàÎã§. ÌïúÎ≤àÏØ§ Í∞ÄÎ≥ºÎßåÌïúÍ≥≥ÏûÖÎãàÎã§.
Ï∂îÏö¥Í≤®Ïö∏ÎÇ† Îî∞ÎúªÌïú ÌñáÏÇ¥Í≥º Ìï®Í∫Ω

Lobster Madness at Sea Wolf is a must!
Had such a great time. The lobster options were amazing‚Äîtried the roll and mac & cheese, both were delicious. The vibe was fun and lively, and the best part? 90 minutes of unlimited drinks included for just $55! Totally worth it. Perfect spot to go with friends and kick off the week right. Will definitely be back!

üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü Ultimate Seafood & Cocktail Spot in Brooklyn!
Went on a Thursday Martini Night $10 martinis till 10pm! Cosmos, Lemon Drop, Life is a peach and the espresso martini were our favorites!! In order of deliciousness,

‚Ä¢	Martini happy hour ‚Äì expertly shaken cocktails served during prime unwind time; the ideal complement to all the seafood indulgence .

‚Ä¢	Lobster rolls ‚Äì truly next-level, bursting with fresh lobster and perfectly dressed. So delicious!
‚Ä¢	Fish tacos ‚Äì crisp, flavorful, and a light, refreshing contrast to the richer dishes .

‚Ä¢	Wagyu burger ‚Äì a luxurious twist on surf‚Äëand‚Äëturf, juicy and indulgent.

With polished yet relaxed vibes, attentive service, and standout flavors across the board, this spot is a must for anyone craving top-tier seafood and cocktails in Brooklyn. Thank you Jason for making our experience an unforgettable one.

Thought the atmosphere was great! Awesome $1.50 happy hour oyster deal, and overall the entrees were solid. We got the sea wolf, PEI mussels, pan seared branzino, fish & chips. I liked everything but the branzino and mussels were my favorite.

The chocolate mousse cake was also really good!
Stopped by last weekend and had an incredible brunch experience with the girls! They have great drink deals & delicious brunch meals. Also, the seafood tower and lobster rolls are amazing!
Amazing lobster roll. Cocktails are decent. We sat at the bar on a Friday night. Casual vibe. Overall good spot for a great lobster roll with a casual vibe.

The drinks and the food were GREAT! We arrived around 3:30 and waited for the 4 pm happy hour to get our drinks. Every drink was A+. We had the frozen rum punch, frozen margaritas and the painkiller without any complaints! The shrimp with grits were different from our norm yet it was good.  We will go again.

The freshest seafood in Brooklyn and they even have a late night happy hour from 11PM to 4AM Fridays and Saturdays where they serve draft beer and wine, signature and frozen cocktails. My favorite mocktail was the salted melonade! Absolutely loved their oysters on a half shell and the hot buttery lobster roll! If you go, order the crispy calamari!

Sat at the bar in the daytime, had frozen margarita! Fresh oysters and lobster roll.
Great prompt service.
I‚Äôm sure the atmosphere gets super fun on an evening
Went to the Spot for late night happy hour and was super love the oysters stupid presentation. Really enjoyed the burger and the lobster mac & cheese.

The service experience was disappointing because they seemed understaffed and disorganized. When I got there at 8:46pm I stood by the wait stand until 9:03pm to be seated. The woman who sat me also waited on my table before busing my table and running drinks. The actual hostess was outside singing and in between songs she was running drinks but not seating anyone she didn‚Äôt know. So by the time I was able to get someone‚Äôs attention it was 9:20  I tried to get someones attention but I don‚Äôt think the backwaters speak decent English then I was able to send up a flare so the only waitress in the building helped me and i ended up ordering the fish n chips with a side of Mac and cheese with a threes brewing Pilsner. The food and drink was not bad but I had better so all in toll please the more you try to save money by understaffing your business the more money you lose.

Perfect First Date Vibes & Stellar Service
Came here on a first date and it hit all the right notes. We stopped in for oysters, fries, cocktails, and a prosecco, simple, but perfect. It was packed when we walked in (prime time Saturday, around 6pm), but we lucked out with seats at the bar.

Enter Marcus, the bartender and absolute star of the show. Despite being knee-deep in a whirlwind of orders, he moved like a pro: quick, focused, and somehow still warm and attentive. Our drinks and food came out fast! Like, impressively fast. Watching him work was like watching a bartender ballet.

The oysters were fresh and briny, the fries golden and crispy, and the frozen drinks? Chef‚Äôs kiss. Just the right hit of booze and slush.

Honestly, I‚Äôd come back just to sit at the bar and watch Marcus do his thing again. 10/10 would recommend, especially if you love a good bar show and damn good oysters.

Love the ambiance and laid back type of seafood.

Eat and drink at your own lace with great accompaniment cocktails. I especially love the daily 4-7pm happy hour.

Overall a great Bushwick establishments and experience. Highly recommended.
I've been to Seawolf many times.  The happy hour oysters were in point. Never a long wait. Servers are attentive.
Really cool place for late night bites! I came with my bf after a night out and tried the warm lobster rolls, clam chowder and oysters! Everything fresh and a chill ambiance
Great vibes! Came for lunch and we got a big spread to share. Loved the mac and cheese, truffle fries, fish tacos, and deviled eggs. Would love to come back to try the burger!

First time dining here, and I really enjoyed the food. My party and I had to be seated outside, which wasn't an issue except for the garbage cans being nearby and throwing off the appetite a little. The food was very very good. I had the filet o fish meal and loved it. The drinks were also delicious as well
Update: Been here to this restaurant a few times now and today I tried the Salmon with garlic broccoli and garlic mash potatoes and it was sooo delicious. I wanted to try something other than my normal go to which is the filet-o-fish and im so happy I did. The vibes here are always nice. I love coming here.

Came for the oysters and stayed for the food!! Their new menu is live and I loved it, the branzino, eggs Benedict, and hot lobster roll are non negotiables when coming here. And please try the Hama Hama Oysters!! Soooooo good‚ú®

I truly enjoyed my time at Sea Wolf. Despite being short staff, the food was amazing and the service was relevantly fast. The lobster roll was the highlight of my meal. Buttery, and warm, just delicious. I recommend getting the kale salad. It was nice and crisp with just the right amount of dressing. The corn and mixed vegetables were also roasted to perfection with the perfect amount of seasoning. I will definitely go back to Sea Wolf in the near future.

I had a light dinner at Sea Wolf. I ordered really good cocktails, balanced and original. But there was a sauce in my food, and it was suspiciously sour and spicy. Unfortunately, my suspicions were confirmed, and after dinner I felt very sickü•∫
I‚Äôll give a second chance this restaurant but a little bit laterü§ûüèª
Thank you!
Incredible atmosphere and excellent food!! Mac & cheese and the kale Caesar were the highlights, but everything was great!!! Need to come back soon
Alvaro and Angelica are amazing! This place has awesome vibes and great food. Definitely a spot to check out in Brooklyn!!

My friends and I went for their lobster madness deal on Monday. The inside was only for reservations which we forgot to make but there were some tables outdoors that they offered us. For outdoor seating I would expect the restaurant to kind of groom the surrounding spaces like the overgrown tree patch next to the seating on the sidewalk. Our food was delicious. We loved everything we ordered. However our waiter consistently forgot about us. I‚Äôm not sure if it was because we were outside or what. But we asked for a to go container maybe 4 times before finally getting it. I asked for my receipt. Never got it. I would go back but definitely with a reservation to sit indoors.

The atmosphere was amazing. Calm quiet chill vibes. The food was amazing and it came out rather quickly. lobster roll w fries EXCELLENT.
The desserts were ok. Ive had better for $10 each.

Just note kitchen closes 3:30-4pm for brunch to dinner menu.

The service was good NOT SPECTACULAR. They added 20% gratuity for 3 people onto our bill. Menu stated gratuity added for groups of 6 or more. No warning of gratuity being added for 3 people BUT the service should‚Äôve been MORE ATTENTIVE if thats the case.

Hard to park. Busy street.

Came on a Saturday evening during happy hour. The food is fine, nothing mind blowing. We ordered a dozen oysters and an order of wings. HH wings are $9 for 5 pieces...l've had a better HH deal elsewhere, esp given that these wings weren't evenly coated and we only received 1 flat piece vs 4 drumsticks. I ordered their Beyond Burger, which had an overwhelming amount of cheese, but was otherwise cooked nicely! I wish their salad had more to it, it was simply just kale and dressing. Not even tomatoes, onions, or other toppings.
This place fell short on staff. We tried to order another round of drinks THREE times, and each time, a server looked directly as us and walked away. We even flagged them down, and they claimed that they had to grab a specific person to put in our order, but we were never tended to. I'm not sure if it was be we were a table of 4 Asians, but it felt a bit that way..
Given my unfortunate experience with the staff, 1 won't be returning.
Great vibe, friendly staffs, delicious oysters and drinks.

Frist of all, I love coming to eat around the area since it was becoming so popular for the restaurant. We made a reservation through the app but after they seated us, the server tends to forget about us so we waited for a while to get serve that was turn off for a place that such a popular.

We had 4 sets of appetizers since my husband wanted something different than me and we didn't agree.
He had.....
- fried Calamari: 8/10: it was crispy and I tried some of them
- Chili Crisp Shrimp: 6/10: I gave this score because it was only 5 shrimp and the sauce and how they prepared and cooked the shrimp wasn't reach my Afor the price of $18 this dish should be only $13
I had......
- A dozen of Oyster: it was ok with happy hour price for $1.5 each
- A dozen of middle neck clams for $1.75 each
Overall my raw bar was good, I love cocktail sauce and spicy sauce they gave me.
For the main curse we both had a whole lobster which i'm ok to work with but my lazy husband only want to have lobster tail but they didn't have anything closer. I ended up have to cracked all shell of the lobster which i didn't mind but I may have to open a Lobster farm to serve my huband who only wants to to eat lobter tale for his laziness. LOL.

Overall, We made a reservation and it was good until we sat to our table. The server let us wait for a while until he realize we were a new customer and didn't order anything yet. The place seem to be busy and lots of worker tend to avoid you when you need something which was bad.

My first approached was very polite and looking around to see anyone available or eyes contact with me. After no one avoiding, so I start to call when someone passing by. I understand if you are busy but communication is must. Good server should at least tell the customer they saw it and they will be back. I don't mind waiting as long as they know they will come back.

This Seafood place is good but if you go when they are busy maybe you cann't expect the good service. Food was good just people who works there were less care.
Alvaro he know want I want and do the great service and I know this place for a long time and love the oysters also they do have happy hour. Recommend üëç

If you‚Äôre looking for the most amazing culinary adventure of your life, and you are seafood lover, please indulge yourself in this restaurant! Do yourself a favor and get any and all of the drinks but the watermelon Sugar high is especially tasty.

All the apps are crazy, but the tuna Crudo, and the ceviche are extra special. You have to get a Lobster of course, but you are full. If you don‚Äôt get the lobster mac & cheese, it‚Äôs literally so good you won‚Äôt want to share!

Dine in dinner review: came here with a group of 4. Plenty of group seating. We made a reservation online and were seated right away. Our server was lovely. Food was super fresh and everyone agreed it was tasty. Drinks were strong. My only con is the quality is much different when I order delivery. Nonetheless, I‚Äôll still return to try out more items from their menu.
First time trying Sea Wolf! Cute indoor outdoor seating for a nice day. Loved the kale salad, mac n cheese, and tacos
Love the comfy atmosphere here. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you feel so relaxed you don‚Äôt want to leave. Food was very delicious.

Fun vibe, great food and drinks. Happy hour was a win- good prices on oysters and drinks. The fish tacos and the pan seared fish with cilantro rice and capers were perfectly flavored! Our favorite meal of our time in the area.

Nice place, happy hour and would go again.

The salmon skin was a bit fishy.

We had made a res for 4 a week in advance for Father‚Äôs day. We arrived on time but were asked to sit outside under the umbrellas while it was raining. Service was not kind or apologetic about it either.

Shoulda left then and there but hoped the food was good - it was disappointing and just too expensive for the portions served. Seafood lovers you are better off finding quality grub elsewhere, feels like this place does not get a lot of repeat customers for good reason.

One of my favorite spots in Bushwick!! Love the vibe in here! Can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve been here but I just love the food, the service and we always have a great experience every time. Happy hour specials are alwas good! I love their oysters, wings (both buffalo and old bay), steak, fish and chips! Honestly you can never go wrong with anything. And don‚Äôt forget to try their famous ‚Äúpainkiller‚Äù my favorite drink! Love this place so much!

If you are in Brooklyn, you have to visit this place for happy hour. They have the best oysters, beautifully shucked, packed with briny deliciousness. The frozen PainKiller cocktail hits the spot and goes beautifully with their other bar food, especially the tempura asparagus and the fish tacos. We were there for the 4th of July long weekend and went everyday.

Food: Their seafood is so fresh and their are so many options. They have great happy hour specials threw out the week as well. The frozen drinks are also delicious. I would highly recommend trying their  shrimp basket, oysters and Pain Killer(perfect pre-game drink).

Service: The service was great! The waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and was very friendly.

Ambiance: This is a very chill and relaxed restaurant. The vibe is giving casual beach club. This def a spot I would come with friends and pre-game before going out.

Overall: I would highly recommend giving them a try and for more reviews check out my Instagram @EmmesEverydayEats!

Really awesome vibe. The fish tacos and chicken and waffles definitely hit the spot. The menu had some interesting refreshing beer selections and the service was very nice and attentive. If you‚Äôre looking for a refreshing atmosphere and a nice place for drinks, food and talk this joint is a good recommendation.
